Never mind, I found out the problem. It is a small silly mistake on my part:
I have 2 installations of Heritrix and I was adding the jar to one of them
but was pointing HERITRIX_HOME at the other.

Sorry for the wasted bandwidth,

Anas

On Wed, Dec 2, 2009 at 8:09 PM, anas elghafari <anas.elghafari@...>wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I want to extend Heritrix by replacing the ARCWriter with my special
> writer/indexer. To test things, I have a class called NotProcessingProcessor
> extends Processor {...} that does not actually do anything. According to a
> note in the developer's manual, all I have to do is write a
> Processor.options file with the line:
>
> testing1.NotProcessingProcessor|MyDummyProcessor
>
> then jar the class and the Processor.options file and put that resulting
> jar file into Heritrix/lib and then Heritrix will incorporate that processor
> into the modules option in UI. That is exactly what I did and I don't see my
> processor in modules settings on the UI. What am I doing wrong?
>
> I am working with Eclipse under Mac OS.
>
> Thanks in advance for any help,
>
> Anas
>

--00163649a18b3f82620479d6f9a4
